Title: Ondo Governor Aiyedatiwa teaches pupils in viral video
Summary: Ondo State Governor, Lucky Aiyedatiwa, returns to his roots as a teacher . Video shows him engaging with students at an unnamed school . The video was shared on the Governor’s official Facebook page .

Title: Troops neutralise kidnap kingpin, ‘Onowu’, terrorising Southeast
Summary: Wanted kidnap kingpin and terrorist, Nkwachi Eze, alias ‘Onowu,” has been eliminated by military forces . Eze was notorious for coordinating multiple attacks and kidnappings across the South East .

Title: Sanwo-Olu inaugurates Epe Emergency Centre
Summary: Babajide Sanwo-Olu has reaffirmed his commitment to increasing investments in health infrastructure across Lagos State . The governor made the announcement at the Epe Emergency Centre .

Title: LP’s crisis is poetic justice, karma – Faduri
Summary: Faduri Oluwadare Joseph described the current crisis rocking the party as ‘poetic justice’ and ‘karma unfolding before the eyes of the nation’ He also said the turmoil is the direct consequence of the party's turmoil .

Title: BudgIT ranks Ekiti first for fiscal transparency
Summary: The Ekiti State Government has applauded the ranking of the State as first in Nigeria . Ekiti was ranked first in the Q4 2024 States Fiscal Transparency League Table by BudgIT Foundation .

Title: From Reims to Roussillon, the Wines Finding Their Way to Bangkok’s Glasses
Summary: After more than a decade in the spirits industry, James Ong shifted his focus to wine . He recognised a gap in Thailand for more thoughtful selections: wines with strong provenance .

Title: Leo XIV says Church must fight ‘lack of faith’ in first mass
Summary: Leo XIV says Church must fight ‘lack of faith’ in first mass . Leo XIV: 'Church must fight 'lack' of faith' in first Mass . The Pope said the church must fight "lack" of faith .

Title: JAMB releases 2025 UTME results, withholds 39,834 others
Summary: JAMB releases 2025 UTME results, withholds 39,834 others . The board disclosed that it is withholding the results over issues relating to examination irregularities .

Title: What aid cuts mean for development finance in Africa: Lessons from the UAE
Summary: Massive cuts in overseas aid from the US, UK, France and other members of the Development Assistance Committee (‘DAC) are putting thousands of lives and livelihoods at stake in Africa .

Title: E-Call up is desirable in Onne ports – Truckers
Summary: The Association of Maritime Truck Owners, AMATO Adeshina Ajibola has said that a call-up system is not necessary at the Onne Port in the Eastern part of the country . He said implementing a fully automated system would not only streamline trade operations but also help prevent road accidents .

Title: Nigeria withdraws from World Relay Championship, blames China visa delay
Summary: The Athletics Federation of Nigeria has announced the country’s withdrawal from the 2025 World Relays in Guangzhou, China, citing issues with the visa process . The late issuance of visas by the Chinese authorities was blamed for the withdrawal . The impact of this withdrawal has been severe, which includes wasted training preparations, significant financial losses, lost

Title: FG to repatriate 15,000 Nigerians stranded abroad
Summary: Federal Government says discussions are ongoing on how 15,000 Nigerians stranded in Cameroon, Niger, Chad, and other parts of the world will be returned to Nigeria in safety and dignity . Federal Commissioner, National Commission for Refugees, Migrants and Internally Displaced Persons, Alhaji Tijani Ahmed, disclosed this at a media

Title: FCT seeks RMAFC’s nod to access fund for infrastructure
Summary: The Federal Capital Territory Administration has approached the Revenue Mobilisation Allocation and Fiscal Commission to seek approval for access to the Natural Resources Development Fund . The presentation was made on Wednesday to the Commission’s Fiscal Efficiency and Budget Committee at its headquarters in Abuja . The fund is designed to support economic diversification through investments in agriculture, solid

Title: [ICYMI] Step-by-step guide on checking 2025 UTME results
Summary: In this year’s UTME, over 1.5 million out of the 1,955,069 candidates who sat for the 2025 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination scored below 200 in the just-concluded exam . This was revealed in the statistical analysis of the 2025 UTME results released by the Joint Admission

Title: PTAD raises alarm over 2025 budget pension arrears gap
Summary: The Pension Transitional Arrangement Directorate has raised concern over the inadequate provision for pension arrears in the 2025 national budget recently signed by President Bola Tinubu . This was disclosed in a statement issued by the Head of Corporate Communications, PTAD, Mr Olugbenga Ajayi .
